meanings.definition: Not following a cycle or pattern.
meanings.sent1: The weather in this region is noncyclical, with unpredictable changes throughout the year.
meanings.sent2: Her noncyclical work schedule meant she never knew when she would have a day off.
meanings.sent3: The noncyclical behavior of the squirrels in the park kept the visitors entertained with their unexpected antics.
meanings.sent4: The noncyclical nature of creativity means that inspiration can strike at any moment, like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The noncyclical nature of the stock market makes it a challenging environment to predict and invest in.

meanings.definition: Not occurring in a predictable manner.
meanings.sent1: The noncyclical arrival of the mail sometimes caused delays in receiving important documents.
meanings.sent2: The noncyclical nature of his moods made it hard for others to anticipate his reactions.
meanings.sent3: The noncyclical bus schedule led to confusion among passengers who were used to more regular timings.
meanings.sent4: Her noncyclical laughter bubbled up unexpectedly, like a hidden spring in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The noncyclical behavior of the wild animals in the safari park added an element of surprise to the visitors' experience.
